item.title: 德国人终于开始使用空调了，连租房者也不例外
item.description:
租户在适应新的气候现实方面面临着有限的选择。【原文：

Tenants face limited options in adapting to the new climate reality.

】

item.title: 德国削减预算让重工业与肮脏技术无缘
item.description: 在德国西部工业中心的一个小镇盖塞克，在当地一家水泥厂启动大规模碳捕集项目的计划已被搁置。【原文：In Geseke, a small town in Germany’s western industrial heartland, plans to launch a large-scale carbon capture project at a local cement plant have been put on ice.】

item.title: 酷热将增加美国中部和东部的电力需求
item.description: 预计为期一周的热浪将给美国中部和东部大部分地区带来闷热的气温和高湿度，给电力和铁路基础设施造成负担，因此电力价格正在攀升。【原文：Power prices are climbing in anticipation of a week-long heat wave expected to bring sweltering temperatures and high humidity to much of the central and eastern United States, taxing power and rail infrastructure.】

item.title: 德国热泵销量首次超过燃气锅炉
item.description: 在德国，热泵的销量首次超过了燃气锅炉，因为禁止使用不清洁的供暖系统迫使人们转向使用更清洁的能源。【原文：Sales of heat pumps in Germany surpassed gas boilers for the first time as a ban on dirty heating systems forces a shift to cleaner energy.】

item.title: 欧洲极右翼人士称应拒绝 2040 年气候目标
item.description: 负责领导议会谈判的极右翼团体认为，欧盟提出的到 2040 年减排 90% 的目标应该被否决。【原文：The European Union’s proposed target to cut emissions by 90% by 2040 should be rejected, according to the far-right grouping responsible for leading negotiations in parliament.】

item.title: 伦敦通勤环境尚未做好应对气候变化的准备
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注彭博社伦敦地铁热指数的最新数据，该指数由我们的天气和气候记者乔-韦尔兹（Joe Wertz）在初夏推出。数据显示，自他开始记录以来，每天从金融中心出发的热门工作日行程都在热浪范围内。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读并与您的朋友和粉丝分享这个故事。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the latest data from Bloomberg’s London Tube Heat Index, which was launched by our weather and climate reporter Joe Wertz at the start of summer. It shows a popular weekday journey from the financial center has stayed within heat wave conditions every day since he started recording. You can read and share this story with your friends and followers on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 伦敦中央线每天都在炙烤着城市乘客
item.description:
布鲁姆伯格的伦敦地铁热指数显示，今年夏天，从金融中心出发的热门工作日 旅程 每天都在热浪范围内。【原文：

Bloomberg’s London Tube Heat Index shows a popular weekday journey from the financial center has stayed within heat wave conditions every day this summer.

】

item.title: 规模达 17 万亿美元的基金负责人认为 ESG 扩展可带来回报
item.description: 日本 249.8 万亿日元（约合 1.7 万亿美元）的养老基金是世界顶级绿色投资者之一，该基金表示，与环境、社会和公司治理相关的投资发展到更广泛的目标，有助于支持回报和经济增长。【原文：An evolution of ESG-related investment to address a wider set of objectives can help support returns and economic growth, according to Japan’s ¥249.8 trillion ($1.7 trillion) pension fund that ranks among the world’s top green investors.】

item.title: 水务公司利用太阳能电池板减少蒸发损失
item.description:
澳大利亚的供应商正在对浮动面板进行测试，以冷却水库并最大限度地减少造成浪费的最大原因。【原文：

Suppliers in Australia are testing floating panels to cool down reservoirs and minimize their largest cause of wastage.

】

item.title: 2023 年 "史无前例 "的海洋热浪表明气候已到临界点
item.description:
研究人员说，当年的海洋热浪异常猛烈，持续时间远远超过平均水平，对生态系统构成了威胁。【原文：

Marine heat waves that year were unusually intense and lasted much longer than average, posing a threat to ecosystems, researchers say. 

】

item.title: 可持续基金反弹，全球资金流入 49 亿美元
item.description: 根据晨星公司（Morningstar Inc.【原文：The global market for sustainable funds recovered in the second quarter after posting record-high redemptions during the first three months of the year, according to an analysis by Morningstar Inc.】

item.title: 上半年美国绿色项目取消额达 220 亿美元
item.description: 今年上半年，在唐纳德-特朗普总统签署税收法案，取消拜登时代的绿色税收减免政策之前，各公司取消、关闭或缩减了价值超过 220 亿美元的清洁能源项目投资。【原文：Companies canceled, closed or scaled back more than $22 billion worth of investments in clean-energy projects during the first half of this year ahead of President Donald Trump’s signing of a tax bill that rolls back Biden-era green tax breaks.】

item.title: 欧洲太阳能发电增长将出现 2016 年以来的首次下滑
item.description: 由于批发电价降低，对屋顶太阳能电池板的需求减弱，欧盟一连串创纪录的太阳能发电部署将在今年结束。【原文：The European Union’s string of record-setting solar power deployment is on track to come to an end this year as demand wanes for rooftop solar panels due to lower wholesale electricity prices.】

item.title: 一个太平洋国家的法庭案件开启了气候诉讼的新时代
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨一个太平洋小国在法庭上的胜诉对一些世界上最大的历史排放国意味着什么。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读更多相关报道。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at what a tiny Pacific nation’s court win means for some of the world’s biggest historical emitters. You can also read more on this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 英国 Actis 公司计划进军东南亚清洁能源领域
item.description: 专门从事可持续基础设施建设的英国资产管理公司 Actis GP LLP 计划在未来两年内将东南亚可再生能源领域的投资翻一番，投资额高达 5 亿美元。【原文：UK asset manager Actis GP LLP, which specializes in sustainable infrastructure, plans to double investment in Southeast Asia’s renewable sector with a spend of up to $500 million over the next two years.】

item.title: 台风可能加强并向菲律宾北部移动
item.description: 向菲律宾北部移动的台风可能会进一步加强，最早于今晚登陆，暴雨和强风可能会对一些水稻和玉米作物造成影响。【原文：A typhoon moving toward northern Philippines may intensify further before making landfall as early as tonight, with heavy rain and strong winds likely to impact some rice and corn crops.】

item.title: 初创公司接近利用压裂技术储存核废料
item.description:
深部隔离公司筹集了 3300 万美元，用于对其放射性物质地下储藏系统进行关键测试。【原文：

Deep Isolation raised $33 million to conduct a key test of its system to stash radioactive material underground.

】

item.title: 岛上气温飙升，塞浦路斯野火造成两人死亡
item.description: 塞浦路斯的一场野火造成两人死亡，烧毁了数十栋房屋，迫使当局下令疏散这个地中海岛屿上的居民。【原文：A wildfire on Cyprus left two people dead and burned dozens of homes, forcing authorities to order evacuations on the Mediterranean island.】

item.title: 特朗普的移民政策是气候技术的噩梦
item.description:
维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）做客《零点》，畅谈移民、创新和失败的后果。【原文：

Vinod Khosla joins Zero to talk immigration, innovation and the consequences of failure.

】

item.title: 加沙战争留下垃圾、疾病和污染等有毒后遗症
item.description:
对加沙的轰炸留下了被污染的土壤、变黑的水、传播疾病和污染的垃圾堆；这一有毒遗产将延续几代人，并延伸到其边界之外。【原文：

The bombardment of Gaza has left contaminated soil, blackened water and mounds of garbage spreading disease and pollution; a toxic legacy that will last generations, and extend beyond its borders.

】

item.title: 中国报告爆发了创纪录的令人痛苦的蚊媒病毒
item.description: 中国南方工业中心的一个城市本月迄今已录得 3100 多例基孔肯雅病毒病例，这是自二十年前该病毒首次在中国大陆出现以来，中国爆发的最大一次蚊媒病毒疫情。【原文：A city in China’s southern industrial hub has recorded more than 3,100 chikungunya cases so far this month, the country’s biggest outbreak of the mosquito-borne virus since it first emerged in the mainland nearly two decades ago.】

item.title: 众议院共和党人提议撤销对国际能源机构的拨款
item.description: 众议院共和党人正在推进取消美国对国际能源机构资助的计划，称该机构在预测清洁能源增长时放弃了客观性。【原文：House Republicans are moving forward with plans to pull US funding for the International Energy Agency, saying the group has abandoned objectivity when it comes to projecting the growth of clean energy.】

item.title: 南方公司首席执行官警告说，如果电费不便宜，就会发生 "革命"。
item.description: 公用事业巨头南方电力公司（Southern Co.【原文：The chief of utility giant Southern Co. warned that Americans will revolt if they end up on the hook for the soaring power costs associated with AI demand.】

item.title: 富国银行成为旧金山和纽约市气候抗议活动的目标
item.description: 数十名气候和人权活动人士聚集在富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.【原文：Dozens of climate and human-rights activists gathered at the main offices of Wells Fargo & Co. in San Francisco and New York to protest the bank’s policies related to climate change and diversity, equity and inclusion.】

item.title: Zelestra 计划向秘鲁可再生能源领域投资 10 亿美元
item.description: 西班牙 Zelestra 公司计划在未来五年内大幅增加在秘鲁的可再生能源发电投资，这部分归功于新的法律框架。【原文：Spain’s Zelestra is planning to significantly increase its investment in renewable energy generation in Peru over the next five years, partly thanks to a new legal framework.】

item.title: 整个国家如何成为气候变化诉讼的目标
item.description: 国际谈判在应对气候变化方面取得的成果喜忧参半，因此一些人转而使用另一种工具来寻求更快的进展：诉讼。【原文：International negotiations have delivered mixed results in tackling climate change, so some people are turning to another tool in search of faster progress: litigation.】

item.title: NextEra 新风电和太阳能项目开工抵御特朗普退税政策
item.description: NextEra Energy 公司表示，该公司已开始建设一系列新的清洁能源项目，预计这些项目将使该公司有资格获得税收抵免，而根据唐纳德-特朗普总统的新税收和支出法案，这些项目将被逐步取消。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc. says it’s started construction on a spate of new clean energy projects, work it expects will qualify the firm for tax credits that are being phased out under President Donald Trump’s new tax-and-spending bill.】

item.title: 瓦努阿图赢得具有里程碑意义的气候变化影响法律战
item.description: 世界上最容易受到气候变化影响的国家之一刚刚赢得了一场具有里程碑意义的法律诉讼。【原文：One of the world’s most vulnerable countries to the fallout from climate change has just won a landmark legal battle.】

item.title: 特朗普撤回 49 亿美元融资用于有争议的输电线路
item.description: 特朗普政府将取消为美国一个输电项目提供的 49 亿美元联邦融资，该项目因与风能有关而遭到共和党议员的反弹。【原文：The Trump administration is canceling $4.9 billion in federal financing for a US transmission project that’s faced backlash from Republican lawmakers over ties to wind energy.】

item.title: 欧盟与中国拟在北京峰会上签署气候声明
item.description: 欧盟和中国正在准备一份具有里程碑意义的气候合作联合声明，此举将有助于在今年晚些时候在巴西举行的 COP30 峰会之前激发动力。【原文：The European Union and China are preparing a landmark joint statement on climate cooperation, a move that could help galvanize momentum ahead of the COP30 summit in Brazil later this year.】
